utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: You've still got the thing... The stupid thing is still on…?

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Mom, you don't have to yell at me.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I've been in labor for over a dozen hours, Justine, and I have to yell. I thought you were gonna miss the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Mom, it's a three-hour drive.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: That's why I called you yesterday after my water broke.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I'm sorry. A partner just dropped a brief on my desk.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Yeah, right. I remember what it's like, but family comes first.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: All right, come on. We're doing good here.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Get this. This is what I wanted.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Gross…

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: You're crowning.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Are you getting — getting this?!

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Kind of. Well, not the actual vagina.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: It's your baby sister!

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: It's my mother's vagina!

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Aaaaah!

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Aaah!

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Is something wrong?

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: What's going on?!

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I don't know, mom.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: My baby! How's my baby?

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: What are they saying?

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I can't tell.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Find out what's going on!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: She's not responding.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: What's happening? What's wrong with my baby? Why doesn't someone talk to me?!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cancel your dinner plans. Short on medical history. She's only eight hours old. What she's not short on is doctors. Unfortunately, none of them have been able to solve her breathing problems.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Immature lungs?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Full term, and they gave her surfactant. Looks like they're fully developed.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I need you a minute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Silent reading time till I get back.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My nanny called. Her daughter has a dance recital tonight. She can't work late. And I have a board meeting tonight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's a problem.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My mother can't come. She has a cooking class.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you've really got a problem.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If only there were... some mature adult in my life who could pinch hit in emergencies like this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Love to, but I'm catching up on my back issues of Nudist Circus. You should see what the fat lady's got under her big top.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: All I need is a warm body. She'll be asleep the entire time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got a sick baby here who needs me. Yours is healthy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You could deal with your team by phone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How about a little something extra when you get home?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not bargaining sex for babysitting. Besides, you owe me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Sex! I still don't see a female doctor in that room. It's making me very unhappy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Out of the goodness of my heart, which will make you happy, which will make you desire me more, which will turn into more sex.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Be at my place at 7:00.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The sperm donor card from the father did note a history of asthma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if her lung problems are not coming from her lungs?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Her heart looks fine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her liver enzymes are elevated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When the liver fails, it stops producing proteins. Specifically the ones that keep your plasma inside your blood vessels and outside your lungs. Fix the liver, she'll have enough breath to keep the entire ward up all night. Foreman... you need to stay after school. I apparently need to apologize. Last week, I should not have gone over your head and allowed Chase to hire a new team member. So go hire someone who liked The Bridges of Madison County.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Do you want me to hire a white girl?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go find a woman, and wipe that self-satisfied grin off your face.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This'll be quick. I've been interviewing people all week. I have it narrowed down to two candidates.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, narrow it down to one before Cuddy starts withholding sex.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh, she hasn't said anything to me about that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said, wipe the grin.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm thirsty.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your mommy says no, 'cause she's mean. If it was up to me...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Juice!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Go back to bed. I said bed!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson! Hey. You up for a boys' night in?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Believe it or not, breathing problems can be caused by a liver problem.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Then what's wrong with her liver?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Probably an abscess. If we find it with the ultrasound, we can drain it, make her better. You'll be able to take her home by the end of the week.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Is she bleeding?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's oozing from her IV site. It's a symptom of liver failure. It's what we would expect to see.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Dr. Cheng, we might need a unit of blood over here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Echogenic area in the liver. Can you make it out?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Doesn't seem to have the thick walls you'd expect from an abscess.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lift her left shoulder so we can get a better look.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Oh, can I do it? I haven't been able to hold her yet.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Can I at least donate blood?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's definitely not an abscess.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It looks like dilated bile ducts.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: What does that mean? Can I still take her home soon?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You were right about the liver. On ultrasound, we found intrahepatic dilated bile ducts. Extrahepatic ducts were normal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. Are... you okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just talking in a soothing voice. Not for your benefit. Why? Is it turning you on?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, there's someone here I need you to meet. I just hired Dr. Christina Fraser. She's a board certified—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice to meet you. You're fired.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House... you're kidding, right? I've done my due diligence. She's the best there is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You had the misfortune to be the lesson that Foreman is learning. That whooshing sound is the air being let out of his ego.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You are such an ass, House. You could have made the same point without crushing the hopes of a young doctor who was actually excited to have this job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I'm not sure I could have. I think you give me far too much credit. Taub... it's your turn to find a young doctor who's actually excited to have this job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not until you or she earns it. Dilated bile ducts could be congenital.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That means that it's a stricture in the ducts themselves. Caroli's syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, open her up.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Surgery? This is a newborn with liver failure. She's oozing blood from every puncture site. It's insanely risky to open her up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You told me you gave them your credit card...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you were dumb enough to believe me. Cuddy'll be back in an hour and ten minutes... I'll be back in an hour and five.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ohhh, no, you don't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, yes, I do.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're not gonna leave the kid?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, I am. 'Cause unlike you, I don't have a conscience.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And unlike you, I'm not having sex with Cuddy, so I actually can leave.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're not gonna leave a two-year-old unattended.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure. I'm leaving her with you. A responsible adult.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Better get back in there. Kid's all alone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's kind of bugging you, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not my problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, since, objectively, you care more about leaving a child alone than I do, it kind of is.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Objectively, since I never accepted this responsibility, it kind of isn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: True, and yet it is. Because you're you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm leaving.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm leaving.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not gonna leave. You can't.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine. You're right. You know what I can do? I can go in there and call a babysitting service for 15 bucks an hour, then call Cuddy and tell her who's watching her kid and why.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll stay if you stay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: ...We were gone two minutes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What have you got there, sweetie?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on now, spit it out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Come on, sweetie. Open. Bah-bah-bah-bah-bah-bah. Bah bah bah!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Open... Ow!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rachel... how many coins did you eat?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Isolating the common bile duct.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And mobilizing the distal end for cannulation.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: BP is down to 50 systolic. You've got to stop the cannulation.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I haven't started yet!

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Hit her with a bolus of phenylephrine. That should buy us enough time to get in and dilate those bile ducts.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: BP is rising. 70 systolic.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nice. I'm in the common bile duct.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Advancing past the cystic duct. No strictures or blockages so far.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: BP is dropping again.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Another bolus of phenylephrine.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: She can't take more. The first bolus is still in effect.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was barely in.This doesn't make sense.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The liver problem alone is not gonna mess with the baby's BP. Whatever this is, it's got to be affecting her heart.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Heart plus the liver. Could be tuberous sclerosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Or it could be a vascular malformation in the liver, causing both problems.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So what do you guys think of Dr. Cheng?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Best treatment for a vascular malformation is surgery. And I think your wife thinks you shouldn't think anything of Dr. Cheng.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No surgery. A newborn baby can't handle another trip to the O.R.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I didn't mean think-think. I meant think as a... potential hire.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What if we started the baby on steroids an anti-angiogenesis agent, and dopamine?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Could work just as well as surgery. Snap those bad blood vessels shut. I'll call House to get approval.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So, what was that shrug? A "Dr.-Cheng-could-work" shrug? Or a "House-is-gonna-crush-you-for-even-considering-her" shrug? ...You suck.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House is gonna hate anyone we hire, because he doesn't want to hire ...anyone.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So you think I should abstain? Just give the decision back to him?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then he'll just mock you for being a wuss. You're screwed.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Unless... House feels like hiring her is his idea...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Still not answering. We should just start the treatment.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay... you ordered the moo shoo pork... and the orange cashew chicken, right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like I always order. Did you clean up in there?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, he could have shortchanged you. Fridge magnet's not getting anything.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's because it's a fridge magnet! Unless she swallowed a Canadian dime, it's not magnetic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? I mean, kids swallow things all the time, right? I mean, she swallowed a dime, she poops it out. She'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Absolutely. Unless it gets stuck in her intestine and causes a blockage, which could kill her.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you don't tell Cuddy, I will go out there and tell her myself!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah? What are you gonna tell her? Are you gonna tell her that... you left coins out? And you left her child unsupervised?!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're telling me to do the right thing while climbing out a window!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Shh! Shh shh shh shh! Tell her!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Did she wake up at all?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ...One time.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's not like her... is she all right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's fine. How about I stay the night? Then you can really thank me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I have to get up early. You won't be able to sleep in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm a deep sleeper.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Round two. Did Justine go home?

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Said she was going downstairs for a few minutes. A few hours ago.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So... you two are close?

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Well, it's been getting better, actually. At least she's here in the building. That's pretty supportive for her. What is it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's pinker.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Is that bad?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's good. ...That's very good.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Was that her?

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Can I hold her?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I think it's long overdue.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Oh! Ohh... My first time... Finally...

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Technically, it's your second time.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I didn't mean—

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I know, mom.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Looks like it was a vascular malformation. The Grogan baby is better.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: She moved. They always move.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: ...It is a good job. Diagnostics. Solve a mystery, save a life. But I suppose you're pretty attached to pediatrics?

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Ms. Young, but I'm gonna have to ask you to restrain your daughter. Now the mom's not gonna want to do it, because she'd rather I just keep blasting her daughter with radiation... You're telling me... that there's an opening in House's department?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Would you be interested?

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: No more kids, no more parents. One case at a time instead of seventeen? Set up the interview.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's possible you won't need to interview.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Relax, I got this.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh... thanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pfft!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry, I'm just... new to all this.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You want me to reset the alarm?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, no. Case is under control. I'm sleeping in.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your boss must really like you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume, since you're calling so early, that the surgery was a rousing success.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And I assume, since you still think we actually did the surgery, you haven't checked your messages in eight hours. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I believe this is what your people term a "poopy call".

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh, the word is "booty".

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I don't know what you're doing, but this is a poopy call.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, what?! I know about the Jew, the black, and the croc-hunter, but when did we get our Asian persuasion on?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Dr. Cheng... is the NICU attending on the case. And she's not here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, then I just wasted a perfectly good racial epithet.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She spotted a vascular malformation in the baby's liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good call... Except for everything you just said. There's no way that our patient has a vascular malformation.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And you can tell that from the vast amount of information you've gleaned from not being here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't need to be there to remember that the patient's A.L.T.s were three times normal. The baby's liver damage is far too extensive. Dr. Cheng's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: In fairness, it wasn't completely her idea. More of a Foreman kinda thing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, then you're an even bigger idiot for trying to cover for her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, we treated for a vascular malformation, and she got better!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, she didn't. Call me when she crashes again.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: ...That went well.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Everything okay? Come on. I know that look.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I'm just... not used to seeing such emotion coming from you.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I just gave birth. I'm, like, one big vat of hormones right now.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: It's not just the hormones, mom! You're different with her. It's okay. It's good. It's just... I can't help thinking "where was this mom when I was growing up?"

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Wow. I never realized you considered me such a failure as a mother.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I don't consider you a failure. I just — ...I never knew that there was an alternative.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Mom... something's wrong.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Oh! Nurse! She's bleeding again!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: All right, she's in her office. Move fast.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You see a double-wide tuchus coming this way, you scream like a girl.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If Rachel wakes up, she's gonna tell Cuddy everything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's two! Last night, she was whining about the giant moose that lives outside her window.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Medusa at 6:00! Don't look back. Move, move!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hello... I'm the friendly moose who lives outside your bedroom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She hates that moose.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hand me the gel.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: ...Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Make it short. And do not pardon the pun.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's crashing again. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is it actually important that I understand what you say?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The baby's bleeding again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm shocked! Oh, no, wait a minute — that's you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, you're a genius.The bleeding means her liver is still failing. It's not a vascular malformation.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, come take a look at this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hold that thought.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House, no! I need you!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Just past the ileocecal valve.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's nothing. It's just an irregularity.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's a dime!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or a pocket of air.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, with FDR's face on it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's not a face. It's a shadow.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, the thing is perfectly round.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, move the wand to the side.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Tickles!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's because I'm the tickle monster.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Gonna tickle you even more! Look at–look at that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We need an X-ray to be sure.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Great, just give her an unnecessary dose of radiation. It's a dime!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House, I know you're in there! Open the door!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I saw your extension on the call. What are you doing down here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, Wilson's got a two-year-old with cancer. She's in a lot of pain. It's very sad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He also has an outstanding bedside manner.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: ...Her liver failure is getting worse. You were right. Now what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The interesting question is not why she's worse now, but why she got better in the first place.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Could have been something we did that temporarily relieved the—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What'd you put her on again?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: After the transfusion, we gave her steroids, dopamine, and the anti — steroids can treat idiopathic hepatic fibrosis. It would explain why she got better and then worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But not the multiple dilated ducts.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, I need you back in here!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cancer kid trumps liver kid. Sorry. Confidentiality. There are rules, you know.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That... is a dime.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It looks mobile. And it's right in the middle of the colon. Prime location for pooping out. We'll give her some laxatives to help it on its way.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sounds to me like someone's going to get some yummy chocolate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're gonna make a great mommy one day. Thanks for waiting. Hook the mom up to the baby. Direct blood transfusion.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: ...And what else?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing else.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's amazing. She's pink and healthy again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mother's touch.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: It's a miracle. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: A blood transfusion isn't a cure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or a miracle.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then why does the baby seem like she's cured?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Our patient can either go through life with the world's longest umbilical cord, or we can discuss the differential for magic blood.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Baby's O2-stats

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either you're Dr. Cheng, or you're early for my mani-pedi.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I thought her expertise could—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Could tell us the O2-stats. I hope you come with some original ideas.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Either the mom's blood is special, which would mean it's treating something specific, which means the baby has a disease... Or mom's blood is just blood, and it's replacing something the baby is missing, which means the baby has a simple deficiency.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Given the liver failure, a deficiency of clotting factors, enzymes, or vitamins are the most likely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Find a donor.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm O Negative, universal donor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hook yourself up. Dr. Cheng, hook me up. Walk with me. My team seems to have taken a shine to you.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: I like them too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume you're hanging around because you want a job.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: That would be a fair assumption.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I'm gonna have to test you. Let's say, two-year-old... swallowed a coin twenty hours ago. She's gonna be fine, right?

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Any signs of obstruction?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For the purposes of this quiz, let's say "not yet".

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: I'd give a laxative, although I wouldn't wait too long. Her bowel could become ischemic, or worse, an intussusception.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Define "too long."

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Another six hours, max. By then, her system is clear. If it's not out, it's not coming out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And then what do I do? I mean, what do you do? It's your test.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: I'd go in with a scope and get it. Did I pass?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not up to me. Talk to Taub.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Men's room?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Turns out toilets are handy in this situation. And I felt relatively sure that Cuddy wouldn't come in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, Cuddy's been in here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Seriously? This must be a terrible place to have s—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is there such a place? Okay, six more hours, then we're going in with a scope and pulling it out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Scope a two-year-old? It's dangerous.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And as you keep pointing out, so is a dime ripping through her intestines.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cuddy will be home from work in six hours. But no big deal. I'll just scream "look over there!" while you quickly shove a scope up her daughter's rectum.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I could offer to baby-sit again, let her have the night out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sure. That won't raise any suspicions.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I wish I was nicer. Hey. Give me your radiation dosimeter.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because it matches my eyes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I think we can say this isn't working. We'll get her back on your blood. That'll help for now, But this means there's an infection. First we need to identify it. We know it's in her liver, so we'll get a sample. Then we can figure out how to help her get better.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I had this baby because I... wanted a chance to be a "special mom". But... not this way.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Problems in radiology. A radiation dosimeter badge turned positive. I could have a CT Scanner that's leaking... a spilled vial of thallium somewhere... I don't even know whose badge it was. The code was scratched off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That had to be intentional. I mean, why would anyone—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't know. All I know is that I'm gonna need to work late. I was actually hoping that you could baby-sit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nooo...

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two nights in a row?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have a life, you know.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I will make it worth your while.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am not going to bargain babysitting for sex. Who the hell said that? Of course I will.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Oh, that thing's nearly as big as she is.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Don't worry. I've done this at least once before.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Advance another centimeter and you're in.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Oh, God, that looks awful. Is that from the infection?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. It means we were wrong. It's a melanoma.

utterance.speaker: Abbie
utterance.content: You mean, like skin cancer? How would she get that? She's never been outside.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But... you have.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: You're saying I gave my baby cancer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's it? How come no one got me food?

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: What do you mean, "that's it"? The woman has melanoma. She could die if we don't—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Boring. Since the baby has the melanoma, we kind of already knew the mom had it.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Yes, but now we know where it is, so we can — ...treat it much more effectively, so...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. So treat her. Also boring. What's interesting is that mom's melanoma spread to the baby in-utero, which means it's metastatic, which means it's late stage. How many people with a late stage melanoma are as healthy as she is?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Clearly, something's going on in mom's blood that's treating her melanoma as well as her baby's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Antibodies.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If her immune system was fighting the melanoma, it never would have spread.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly, which means it's fighting something else, and the melanoma cells are getting caught in the crossfire. So what's mom's immune system really shooting at?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Scleroderma can cause cancer-fighting antibodies.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So can Churg Strauss... pretty much any auto-immune disease.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Or infections that cause granulomas, TB, mycobacteria.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See, Dr. Cheng? This is not boring. Start with auto-immune. Go test her blood. And leave your food.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You can't blame yourself.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I ate all the right foods, I read all the books and the studies, and I... even hired a private detective to research each sperm donor. I just missed one big thing. My own cancer.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm all done here. We'll have the results soon.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: And if that's what this is? An auto-immune disease?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Treatment's... fairly simple.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: And if it's something else?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Let's just take this one step at a time. Stop beating yourself up.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I'm sorry, mom. Not just for this, but for what I said earlier. I was jealous and angry, and... I lashed out. But you were a great mom. You are a great mom.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I don't deserve such a good daughter.

utterance.speaker: Chang
utterance.content: Negative for scleroderma...

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So, what did House want earlier?

utterance.speaker: Chang
utterance.content: He just gave me a little quiz and said he was okay with hiring me, but that it was your decision. Negative for dermatomyositis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's just saying that to set me up.

utterance.speaker: Chang
utterance.content: So you're — you're not offering me the job?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If he wants me to offer you the job, something's going on.

utterance.speaker: Chang
utterance.content: That... was my thinking too. It's not Lupus.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Things with House are never as simple as they seem. Trust me, he's got an ulterior motive, and I've got to figure it out before I do anything.

utterance.speaker: Chang
utterance.content: ...Okay. Mom's negative for Churg Strauss. This isn't auto-immune. Time to scan her for infections that could cause granulomas?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Third poop in the last half-hour. Still nothing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Either it's a trap or it's not. Just hire her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lungs clear for granulomas... Yeah, who cares? Did you enjoy that bear trap snapping on your leg yesterday?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You do realize it's just a metaphorical trap? You'll still have all your limbs. Fourth rib about the midclavicular line. You're over-thinking this. House fired my pick sight-unseen. He was never even interested in Chase's pick, he was only obsessed with how she reflected on Chase. Dr. Cheng is the only candidate he's actually responded to. You wanted House invested. He is. Hire her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And you think I'm over-thinking this?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Shut up and hire her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: ...Look.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Oat cell lung cancer.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She has two cancers?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cancer treating cancer?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You have lung cancer.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I thought I had skin cancer.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: As unlikely as it sounds, you have both.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Actually, the lung cancer is basically treating the skin cancer. It's why you're not feeling sick. And why your blood's helping your baby.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We found it early, so it should be treatable. In a way, your daughter saved your life. We'll get you set up for the surgery and start you on chemo.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: What about Kayla?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She'll only need the chemo.

utterance.speaker: Abbie
utterance.content: Can't you just keep giving her my blood?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not once we cut out the tumor. Your body will stop making the antibodies that are keeping your baby healthy.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: Can you hold off on my surgery?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Over the last day, your baby's liver tumors have shrunk 15%. Projecting forward, it would take eight or nine days to completely eradicate her cancer cells.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: So let's take the eight or nine days—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The cancer probably won't spread in the next nine days, but there are other risks. Cancer thickens your blood, which could cause clots.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: What are the risks to putting my baby on chemo?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It could damage her brain or affect her development, but these risks are small compared to the risks that you would be taking by leaving your cancers untreated.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I want to wait.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Mom. Are you listening? This is way too dangerous.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I'll take the risks. I want what's best for my daughter.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I'm your daughter too.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: She's a baby. You're an adult.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: So what? I don't need my mom anymore?

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: No. You never did. 'Cause I wasn't there for you. But look at you. You turned out great.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Oh, you don't know if I'm great. You don't know me at all. And I'm not gonna let you martyr yourself for a two-day-old infant just because you feel guilty because you weren't around for me.

utterance.speaker: Abbey
utterance.content: I'm not martyring myself. It's nine days. Let's hold off on the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You brought food? This is a medical procedure, not a dinner date!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm aware that this is a delicate procedure. I'm also aware that my hands are shaking from low blood sugar 'cause I haven't eaten all day. So while this may seem insensitive, this crucial, lifesaving moo shoo — where are my extra pancakes? Damn it, they forgot the extra pancakes for my moo shoo pork. Every time that new girl with the blue streak in her hair answers the phone, they screw up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was she there when you picked up the food?!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You ordered extra pancakes?? How much did they cost? Where—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 55 cents. And there were two.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So that means the total on the last bill was—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was—

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: ...Yeah. So the image that we saw on the ultrasound—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was obviously just a pocket of air, like I said all along. But you saw the worst case scenario... ...like every irrational, worried parent. You'd make a terrible mommy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: ... give me some dumplings?

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: Mom, I brought you some — Mom? Mom! We need help in here! Somebody help us!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: ...she died in seconds.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Wouldn't have happened if she let us remove the tumor.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Probably not. Postmortem, we were able to harvest all of her blood. It's enough to treat the baby.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: That's something.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pretty amazing case. Thanks for your help.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: I was glad for the chance to work it with you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I've thought about it, and... ...I'd like to formally offer you the job.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: It's funny, I–I wanted to work on House's team... until I started working with his team.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. Chase and Foreman can get a little—

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: Actually, it's you. I get that House is an ass, but at least he owns it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You don't understand. This whole thing was just a game to House. I didn't have a choice.

utterance.speaker: Cheng
utterance.content: You're a grown man, Dr. Taub. You can make whatever choices you want, and instead of hiring me when he said you could, you chose to act like a paranoid, scared little kid. I hate kids. Good-bye, Dr. Taub.

utterance.speaker: Justine
utterance.content: I'll make sure you never forget her... and what she did for you. She was just trying to be the best mom in the world. She was.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This one's all yours.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What happened to helping out?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ...I did.
